description: From Sherpa. The verb derives from the noun.

entries.meaning: (countable) A local mountain guide or porter, particularly a male of the Nepalese Sherpa people so employed.
(countable) An expert accompanying a high-ranking leader to a summit meeting.
A synthetic fabric with a long, thick pile, similar to faux fur, imitation lamb wool, or fleece.

verbs.description: sherpa (third-person singular simple present sherpas, present participle sherpaing, simple past and past participle sherpaed)

entries.meaning: (rare) To serve as a guide or porter for another.
